title: Front Desk Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX)
Interview Descriptions: It went well it was a lot of scenario based questions and what you would do if you were faced with certain situations with patrons at the John Peace Library
Interview Questions: What would you if a patron was angry

title: Chemist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio
Interview Descriptions: They ask standard questions that you would expect in any interview and background experience so as long as you have a solid resume you are good so yeah it is what it is
Interview Questions: Name an obstacle and how you overcame it

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio
Interview Descriptions: The interview process for UTSA’s CPE Student Assistant I position was easy-going but professional. The hiring manager made everything a breeze and was very communicative throughout. I would definitely recommend being familiar with desk work and being able to assist with computer related tasks.
Interview Questions: Q: What experience do you have with videography?

title: Visiting Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio
Interview Descriptions: Great experience during the interview process. The faculty made me feel very accepted. It was a welcoming atmosphere of people at different stages of teaching.  I would always interview again.
Interview Questions: They asked about the syllabus I would intend to teach .

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX)
Interview Descriptions: The process was seamless, fair, helpful and clear. I knew what to expect before I got to the interview. I understood how to prepare myself as the job listing was clear. The employer provided all relevant information about the job (expectations, benefits, hours, salary) that allowed me to make my decision.
Interview Questions: What kind of research experience I had? How long I've been doing research? Areas of interest?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: They read my recommendation letter and my resume and let me come on to the program. There was no interview process because it was a research program not a job.
Interview Questions: There was not interview questions

title: Enrollment Services Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was streamlined due to COVID, so all interviews occurred either through phone calls or ZOOM sessions. They occurred with either one or two people at the most.
Interview Questions: What are some of the weaknesses you see in yourself, and how can you overcome them?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio
Interview Descriptions: I had one face to face interview by professor after the HR round . Everything went fine. And I just want to fill this up to see the details I am interested to know.
Interview Questions: whats your fav research field.

title: IT Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: Setup a meeting on Zoom, once setup they just sent me a link before hand and we met up. It was about a 15 minute interview, felt very casual and friendly.
Interview Questions: If you had to describe the internet to someone that has no concept of it, how would you?

title: IT Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio
Interview Descriptions: It was easy fairly non technical interview. The interview was mor ebase don behavior rather than knowledge or experience. Overall a nice easy great experience to apply to the university of Texas at San Antonio.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have working on system framework

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio
Interview Descriptions: Interview was over Zoom. Very thorough and thoughtful. Interviewer is your future boss so you’re able to get a general feel of each other. Very quick, fast, to the point and easy.
Interview Questions: What do you have to offer this department?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: The process was online on zoom. The questions were very common questions. It was more about finding the right culture fit with the team. Overall, I got an answer back super fast.
Interview Questions: What is your previous expreience?

title: Head Cheer Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: A bunch of canned questions.  It was obvious that they already had the job filled. They only conducted interviews out of legality, which is so wrong. All of the prospective candidates had their hopes up for nothing.
Interview Questions: When was a time as a coach that you experienced adversity and how did you handle it?

title: One Stop Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio
Interview Descriptions: Scheduled an appointment with a senior counselor, the associate director and one mid level staff member for interview. I was asked a series of questions regarding why I wanted to work with student services, where I saw myself in the future and my overall goals.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have working in higher education?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio
Interview Descriptions: Easy, had single and group interactive interviews. None of them hard, just looking for personable and warm people with some social skills and a desire to moderate the dorms. Show up be yourself and outgoing should be a synch.
Interview Questions: Who is your favorite super hero?

title: Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio
Interview Descriptions: It was extremely easy going,They made me feel comfortable and relaxed. It was a very casual atmosphere.With a panel interview. I would be prepared to answer return of questions about your background
Interview Questions: What are your biggest challenges

title: Senior One Stop Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was conducted via Zoom with the search committee which was made up of four other Senior One Stop Counselors (one was not in attendance). They were very personable, professionial and made the interview go by smoothly. They did a great job of making the Zoom interview less awkward than I have experienced in the past.
Interview Questions: What qualities do you think are most important in a leader?

title: Supplemental Instruction Leader Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio
Interview Descriptions: The interview only composed of one (1) phone call. They asked about your performance in the class that you intended to teach and how you felt about your performance in class. It was fairly straight forward. There is no need to worry; it was rather easy.
Interview Questions: How did you feel that you did in the class in question?

title: Student Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio
Interview Descriptions: Easy questions and great experience for a first job. They made you want to become part of the team. More like a conversation rather than an interview. Questions were mostly about you and your interests in the future.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, please.

title: Tenant Researcher - RVA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process that I participated in was average with questions and protocol.  I found the process to be fair.   Nothing out of the ordinary.  That is all I have to say about it.
Interview Questions: Describe what interested you in the position?

title: Athletic Department Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very welcoming and did not  make you feel nervous at all! It is a great environment with a  great group of people! Very laid back. Interviewed and knew within the week about the job
Interview Questions: What made me interested in working here

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview, just standard questions on your experience with students and teaching and how your time keeping skills were. As well as how often you can work. Was more a discussion then an interview.
Interview Questions: How did you overcome adversity.

title: Administrative Associate II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Received an email for date and time for interview.   Met with the search committee was very pleasant and had great questions about my experience as an Administrative Assistant from my former job.
Interview Questions: Describe your experience as an Administrative Assistant.  What were your daily duties?

title: Graduate Recruiter/Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Put application in online and received a call to schedule an interview 2 weeks later. Had to pay for parking for the interview. Interview was with 3 reps--Director, Assistant Director, and Senior Recruiter. Questions were read from a paper that contained all of the questions. Each rep took turns asking questions about previous job experience and information about myself. Was offered a salary range between $31,000-34,000.
Interview Questions: Give me 5 adjectives that describe you.

title: Applications Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview took an hour. There were 3 people on the panel. They were very professional and also welcoming. It felt like a very positive and friendly atmosphere. A hiring decision will be made in the next 2-3 weeks.
Interview Questions: Explain how you would get students, staff and instructors to embrace digital fluency, and integrate Adobe Creative Cloud into the culture.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (New York, NY) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions:
it was great. and I felt great. which was overall great.
I feel it was very comfortable. the questions were easy but tricky.Given the number of applications we receive, this new and exciting technology will give you the opportunity to showcase your talents and experience beyond an application or resume.
Interview Questions:
tell me about yourself.
why should i hire you.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: It is 30 mins phone interview and a one-day on-campus interview. Questions are very general and the on-campus interview is a 45 mins presentation. The entire process happened in two weeks. It was very stressful, but it was good.
Interview Questions: How is your experience related to this position?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: I first got an email from the professor that I was assigned to, to see if I was the right fit for him and his work he set up an interview with me via telephone call.
Interview Questions: He asked me what knowledge I knew of the databases used at utsa

title: Supplemental Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was over the phone and I was asked mainly behavioral  questions that had to do with my experience in helping others understand and teach them something they knew nothing about. They also asked how I handled certain academic situations.
Interview Questions: Can you tell me about a time you were tasked with motivating others to learn something new?

title: Outdoor Pursuits Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: Panel of 5 people including the manager and staff; they ask you personal questions about your goals, outdoor experience, reason for wanting to work there; they ask you to present a topic for 1 minute and you can use the white board; they rate you throughout the interview
Interview Questions: If you could crush anything, what would it be?

title: Visitor Experience Coordinator- ITC Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX)
Interview Descriptions: I applied at the end of the job posting closing date. Applied on the 21st, was contacted by phone on the 26th, was interviewed on the 1st and was emailed that I was not selected on the 16th. From the first phone call I got the impression they had a candidate in mind already, as the hiring manager said "We are just finishing up our final rounds of interviews". On the big day I was interviewed by three people. The interview began late and started with  "Do you have any questions for us?" which is a strange way to begin, as that usually comes at the end of an interview. Then they started asking questions from a standardized set. They explained that everyone got the same set of questions. They did not make eye contact and rarely looked up from their papers. Toward the end of the interview the person who would supervise the position I was applying for actually answered a cell phone call and briefly spoke to the lead interviewer about the call as I was answering the final question "Tell us why we should pick you over all of the other candidates". Needless to say I was not surprised that they went with another candidate. Disappointed, sure, but not surprised. After reading what I just wrote, I think it is for the best.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your retail experience, you teaching experience, experience with the Americans with Disabilities Act, as a tour guide, working with volunteers, disaster preparedness, and in customer service. Their "throw you for a loop" question was if you were a cartoon character, who would you be and why.

title: CS Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio
Interview Descriptions: Its pretty easy, they just ask you if you have experience in a language and you say yes or no and your experience in the language, ex: c, java, scripting, bash, terminal, awk, and, etc.
Interview Questions: Do you know C?

title: Computer Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and got a call for interview after couple of months. About 30 to 35 minutes long interview.  Easy questions, comfortable interview process and very friendly environment.  I was offered the job right after the interview ended.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a situation at work place when a member of your team does not perform his/her job adequately?

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Only one interview was required. I was mostly asked questions that dealt with solving problems as it related to customer service (i.e. handling irate customers, multitasking, etc.). There weren't any technical questions about software, but more so on having a decent understanding of Microsoft Office and using Handshake.
Interview Questions:
If a person walks in and the phone rings at the same time, what do you do?
What are your strengths and weaknesses?
Tell me about a time you had an irate customer and what you did to resolve the situation.

title: Supplemental Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio
Interview Descriptions: Applied in person, met with team lead then director, was hired pretty swiftly, then had training before the school year started with a large group of other like minded students who seemed to be excited aswell.
Interview Questions: How can you see yourself helping other students?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Every office is different and HR needs to  be more uniform on how initial interviews should be done.  They will do a panel interview if you get to that round. I would recommend you study the new strategic plan and how you can help.
Interview Questions: Again every office is different but you need to know info on the university.  Recently applied for a job at main campus and the hiring committee took a long time to respond to me. Apparently they had a difficult time comparing results on their applicant ratings /  scoring.

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (Houston, TX) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was a Skype interview because I was out of town and they basically asked me a couple of questions about teamwork, collaborating, and what have you. They also asked me about my availability.
Interview Questions: How would you describe teamwork?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my resume for a teaching assistant position and I was never contacted by the supervisor, however, I went to the specific department offering the position and met with the supervisor and I was offered the position instantly.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience teaching/tutoring/mentoring?

title: Supplemental Instructions (SI) Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions:
1 interview 
Pretty easy 
If they don’t reply that means they didn’t find you a position 
So it’s pretty easy simple and straight forward. They are happy to answer any questions
Interview Questions: Tell us your experience about SI

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio
Interview Descriptions: No phone interview. I was invited for an on-campus interview with several faculty and a program coordinator. We talked for about an hour, and I was given a tour of the facilities. I received an offer via phone a short time later.
Interview Questions: How does this position align with your overall career goals?

title: Faculty, Cyber Security Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio
Interview Descriptions: Telephone interview was scheduled and completed. Follow up thank you e-mail. Two weeks later asked for a status on the process and received no answer. Found out later that the position was still open and it still showed my status as having been sent to the hiring authority. The interview was in December it is now March.
Interview Questions:
What are you research interests?
Who would you like to research with?

title: Blank Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio
Interview Descriptions: Received contact for initial phone interview 2 months after applying. One week later interviewed in person with a panel. Came in for background check. Received official offer 3 weeks later.
Interview Questions: Are you willing to work outside of normal hours, meaning nights and weekends, if needed?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio
Interview Descriptions: I was required to discuss my relevant experiences that would make me capable of successfully completed the job. I was also asked about relevant experiences working with a team.
Interview Questions: What experience have you had teaching peers?

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was really great conversations with the professors in Information Systems and Cyber Security department. I prepared for a day and I think I did good job on the interview.
Interview Questions:
Why do you choose us?
Which research do you want to do in the future?

title: Operations Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online for the Operations Assistant position at the Campus Recreation Center. After I did the online application I was called in for an interview that lasted about an hour with the operations manager. I was hired right after the interview. The questions were pretty standard.
Interview Questions: What is my biggest weakness? Describe a time I had to diffuse a situation with a customer.

title: Solutions Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (Austin, TX) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: interview for a solution engineer position it took 30 mins by phone, generally was a good experience,i learned a lot, the interviewee was very supporting and a good listener, he gave me positive feed back
Interview Questions: why do you want to work for us

title: Accounting Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX)
Interview Descriptions: There were two rounds of interviews, one with staff members as a panel and one with supervisor.  It started early and lasted for a few hours as things were running late.  I filled out a background check before leaving and they also called my references.  The two interviews were on the same day making it easier to attend.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Very smooth and well run. Everyone involved was welcoming and eager to answer all questions about the position. I came away with a very good impression of the department and the school based on the day-long interview process. The schedule was not overly demanding, which can be the case at other universities.
Interview Questions: Questions about teaching philosophy.

title: Seasonal Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very pleasant, the interviewer seemed to already want to give me the job. Went through basic questions and asked if I was comfortable handling money. Also wanted to know if I could handle a fast paced environment.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you worked in a team.

title: Enrollment Services Officer I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio
Interview Descriptions: You apply online through UTSA's job website.  They did not take long in contacting me; maybe a fortnight.  I was asked to come in to interview the week after.  The interview was short questions that were scripted.  The interview itself was mildly uncomfortable.  The interviewers were in a hurry, and I'm not quite sure they even paid attention.  They said at the interview that they would contact everyone regardless of whether they had been offered the position or otherwise, but I have yet to hear back over a week later.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you had to make a decision based on something possibly unethical.

title: Student Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with three different people, one was the Director, the other was his assistant and the last one was the front desk lady. The interview took about thirty minutes. I was then offered the job and to start right away. They went into detail about the interview
Interview Questions: Can you multitask?

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: interview was short, one interviewer was warm and receptive, the other was cold and not very friendly.
Interview Questions: What would be your first course of action upon taking this position?

title: Student Assistant - University Center Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of fifteen questions about myself, situations I have been in, and behavioral questions. They then asked me about my availability, class schedules, and other extracurricular activities i am involved in.
Interview Questions: What is your ideal work environment?

title: Facilities Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Some departments interview by committee and take MONTHS to respond to applicants. Others move very quickly.  Feedback is near impossible with the automated system. I recommend contacting the hiring department directly with questions and avoid HR at all cost.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had to deal with a difficult customer.

title: Administrative Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very typical of an average interview. I thought it went great actually, but was not offered the job. I have applied to many positions at this university (at least 15) with only one call back/interview, but I have realized that UTSA just does not hire their alumni who are very qualified for the positions. But overall, I had a good experience with my interview process.
Interview Questions: Name three attributes about yourself that you pride yourself on.

title: Openstack Trainee Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview is based on basic data strucrures and algorithms nothing too depth asked in interview it was easy, any one with basic programming skills should be able to crack this interview, Interview is held at OCI in UTSA.
Interview Questions: write factorial program.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio
Interview Descriptions: No formal interview process.  Some simple questions via e-mail or phone, your background, etc.  I took an opportunity to visit the campus and meet the staff.  This helped me blend into the mix once I started.
Interview Questions: Not a formal interview process, no real interview questions.

title: Fitness Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process is very easy, you apply online and usually get a call back relatively soon with some behavioral questions.  If they feel like you are a good candidate they then will ask for you to come in for an interview.
Interview Questions: What exercises would you do to increase strength in your hamstrings?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio
Interview Descriptions: the interview itself was pretty easy and the questions, the questions were  mainly basic. They asked most about the duties that i did at my previous job. the manager and the supervisor that interviewed me were very friendly. it didnt really feel like an actual job interview
Interview Questions: what was your duties at your previous job

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was taken by My Dean of the Gradute School along with the one whom i was replacing both asked me some questions regarding my skills in dealing with data and my approach to generate reports.
Interview Questions: Mathematics, Statistics

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was with the professor directly . we apply through our co ordinator and he tells us about the opportunities. Then we meet the professor, he interviews us and then he sends a job offer letter to the co ordinator of the department. we will start on the start of the academic semester
Interview Questions: How interested are you in this job and teaching

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions:
You will get a call from the department and ask to give one TA exam. If you clear it you will be hired.
You will be asked about the subject which have got the call from. They will ask you to do some assignment
Interview Questions: Academic background

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with one individual and it was fairly obvious that I was seriously considered for the job because I was introduced to the entire office. I submitted my resume and applied through Rowdy Jobs.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you brought a team together for a project.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Apply for the position in time with necessary documents. Make sure your GPA is good. It will help the department to filter you out from the other students. Make sure to be apt in responding once you get the call.
Interview Questions: Background Knowledge related to the lab.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Easy Interview, I was asked behavioral questions. It was a great experience. The only thing was that I was not told another manager would be in the interview, thus I was not able to do research and was not able to prepare completely.
Interview Questions: As a mechanical engineering major, what was your senior design project?

title: U/I Developer/Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: The process is pretty long. Usually a phone interview followed by a face to face with a group of managers. Once HR approves the hire an offer letter is sent. There is not a lot of negotiation with the offer.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation were you encountered a problem with another employee and how you handled the situation.

title: Computer Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by two different supervisors, questions were mainly behavioral questions like tell me about yourself, and other technical questions about blackboard, word, excel, power point. Behavioral questions like Tell me about a situation of stress at work and how you handled it?
Interview Questions: Tell me about a situation of stress at work and how you handled it?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was average. 10 questions in total. 5 related about the job and the other 5 about personality. It started with a broader description of the job then we moved to the questions. At the end I have time to ask questions.
Interview Questions: What do you know about this position? Why we should hire you? Tell me about your accomplishments.

title: Lab Technical Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Brief about the interview is fast and the OCI facility needs one guy knowing about cloud technology and experience of development on cloud platform. The advisor interviewed me on the 2nd day, and 1st is HR behavior test. Talking with them are relax and pleasant, and the advisor showed me many future plans of this institute.
Interview Questions: Can you explain what is Openstack or AWS system?

title: Senior Network Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (Cincinnati, OH) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Friendly but they were looking for a very specific fit with one particular piece of network hardware that I have a good but not expert level of experience with.  I participated in multiple phone interviews and than a one on one in person interview with a panel of three company representatives.
Interview Questions: scripting and I rule policies on F5 load balancer

title: Senior Enterprise Architect Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Called by their contractors, whom did a pre- technical interview, upon passing. They emailed and called me to set up a telephone tech screen for the college, upon passing I was scheduled and face to face interview with the IT team .  Each member asked different what if and how do you perform or fix different reports or problems . Later I was told they really liked me and was considering me for the position, After four weeks I was told I would be working for the contractor for 6months before becoming a full time UTSA employee and a new offer letter.
Interview Questions: SQL Database Admin question about monitoring servers.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by the director, she was friendly and asked questions about my personality and previous office experience. Later on when I started working there I realized that applicants are usually  interviewed by 3 hiring managers  but when I was called for an interview the other hiring managers were on vacation so I was only interviewed by the director.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a conflict you had with another co-worker and how did you resolved it?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by one or two people. Standard questions were asked and interviewers are very polite, professional, and understanding. This is a good preparation for an interview in other office and professional careers
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time you showed leadership.

title: Project Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: They asked me more about myself and self-growth type of questions. Richard Rendon was my employer. I had an interview and I got hired at the moment. The paperwork was longer than the interview process.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite instrument?

title: Dispatch Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: handed resume in person. received a call a couple days later to have a face to face interview. Pretty straight forward nothing you have not seen in past interviews.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you were faced with a difficult coworker

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Slow, a bit cold because so formal. Panel asked rounds of questions, but they seemed nice. Answered all my questions well. Got the offer but was told no negotiation on salary, which was concerning.
Interview Questions: Nothing uncommon

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was invited by phone for an in-person interview with a committee about a week after the job posting closed.  There were  5 people on the committee and they asked a series of behavioral interview questions around the following competencies: organizational skills, time management, work efficiency, job knowledge, crisis intervention and communication skills.
Interview Questions: What qualities do you possess that will make you an ideal candidate for this position

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX)
Interview Descriptions:
Before beginning the interview, the manager must define the skills needed to fill the position. This, along with careful applicant research and candidate selection, helps to ensure a smooth interview process.

Critical Skills. To secure the right person for a job, the manager must define the necessary skills for the job, often called the critical skills. These describe exactly the skills a person needs successfully to perform the tasks. Sample critical skills could be phrased as "facility with communication," "high degree of organization," or "ability to work well independently." Critical skills are expanded upon in the job description and help guide the manager during the selection process and then provide structure for the position throughout employment.
Interview Questions:
Before beginning the interview, the manager must define the skills needed to fill the position. This, along with careful applicant research and candidate selection, helps to ensure a smooth interview process.

Critical Skills. To secure the right person for a job, the manager must define the necessary skills for the job, often called the critical skills. These describe exactly the skills a person needs successfully to perform the tasks. Sample critical skills could be phrased as "facility with communication," "high degree of organization," or "ability to work well independently." Critical skills are expanded upon in the job description and help guide the manager during the selection process and then provide structure for the position throughout employment.

title: Academic Advisor I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an application and they called me 2 weeks later. The director seemed to be all over the place, giving me directors. But that was okay. I found it. Parking was really hard, I ended up parking at one of the garages they had. I also ended up with a $75 ticket. I wish they would have planned it a bit better. During the interview, I was asked about my personal experience with academic advising, and learned a bit about their population and who we would be serving. Learned about the goals of the department and the transition process from Student Placement to other advising areas. The interview was set up with two advisors and the director. Each advisor had questions and went around asking questions "round robin" that pertained to advising. It lasted up to an hour.
Interview Questions: Explain you advising philosophy, and how do you use it when working with students?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Just one phone interview and one face-to-face interview with the professor. The professor are helpful and I am happy working here now. 100% recommend to get a TA or RA job when you are on-campus as a full-time student.
Interview Questions: What are the technical skills you have for helping research work and prove with some examples.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio
Interview Descriptions: Many questions are about your core values and how they fit with UTSA's core values. I was very surprised about that. Some technical questions, and the usual qualifications questions. Everyone was very welcoming. They definitely made me feel comfortable which took some nervousness away. Overall, it was a very good interview.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Teacher/Clinical Teacher Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: I acquired the position by sending in all of my educational background and teaching certifications via e-mail. All information was reviewed by the supervisor. The supervisor looked over all of my credentials and had me fill out the necessary paperwork.
Interview Questions: What is your teaching experience? What certifications do you have?

title: A/V Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Lots of technical questions. What was my previous work experience in the audio/visual field? How do you do in a group environment? How did you hear about this position? What type of software/hardware do you know or have worked with?
Interview Questions: How would you fix a problem with this equipment?

title: Advanced Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: I received a call shortly after I emailed my resume to the supervisor. It was a simple, short, friendly interview. He asked did I have any questions and I didn't. He walked me around the lab and explained what I would be doing and other students I would be working with.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with conflict?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: applied, and got the interview. Basically was asked how to study and how to teach. How to deal with various situations between students and tutors. She was very friendly and made the interview very easy going.
Interview Questions: will you help student cheat

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: The questions were pretty hard in terms of what UTSA programs were available or that we had. If I wasn't as involved as I was I probably would not have been able to answer some of those questions. Once you apply, they call you if they are interested. After, you go to the interview and you get asked questions that some people ask you during your tours.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite place at UTSA?

title: Events Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX)
Interview Descriptions: The online form is cumbersome and seems fitted for the students, versus professionals, but it's necessary.  The interview process is individualistic, and each department is handled differently.  The questions were standard for this position.
Interview Questions: Provide your complete understanding of the job for which you are applying.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio
Interview Descriptions: Phone interviews-as I was overseas, followed by thesis description and present work responsibility description.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Asked several difficult questions for the candidate. Also mentioned a focus of the job duties entailed.
Interview Questions: What are your greatest strengths and weakness.

title: Senior Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was given three separate interviews.  The first was a phone interview where I was  initially "screened" to confirm my interest in the job.  Next followed two separate in-person interviews with a panel of five people.  In each, I was questioned for little over an hour about my qualifications and experience.  Following the third and final interview, I was made an offer.
Interview Questions: "What experience has made you qualified for this job?"

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview. I interviewed with the director of PhD program and it was a laid back, nice interview. I asked many questions, which I know made a good impression, but I was also promised a lot in order to incentivize me to come to UTSA and not all of it materialized.
Interview Questions: Why PhD? What do you want to study/ research?

title: Grahic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio
Interview Descriptions: First interview was a phone interview, followed by an in person interview. I interviewed with four people at one time as each reviewed my portfolio.
Interview Questions: None, everyone was very friendly.

title: Supplemental Instruction Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: The Supplemental Instruction department uses paper job applications, which they have available in the office. Check back with them often for best results in getting called back for an interview. The interviews are also done in the supplemental instruction office. The interviews are conducted by the team leaders, who are all very nice. Usually they will get back to you quickly if they have a class available which they think you would be a good fit for.
Interview Questions: They have access to your grades, so be prepared to talk about your GPA and/or grades in whichever classes your applied to SI for.

title: Multimedia Designer II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Good interview. I fell pretty confortable. 3 People comitee: Project Manager, Design services manager and Marketing executive. They asked me the expected questions on an interview, took like 1.5 hours, I received an offer a week later
Interview Questions: Why I wanted to leave my current job

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: After applying on rowdyjobs, I sent my resume and a cover letter to the person in charge of the program.  Then I was told to meet with him in his office, there the interview took place.
Interview Questions: Why UTSA?

title: Operations Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: If you know someone who works here, then the interview process is almost non-existent. They are big on personality and require a personality test. Overall it is a social position.
Interview Questions: How did you find out about this position?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview was taken by a professor. He asked me couple of questions regarding my background which where nothing difficult. He then gave me a small project done by one of his previous students and told me to expand upon it within 7 days. He did not give any specific goals to reach with the project. Just told me to create e future plan to take this project/research forward and show some preliminary results. This project was related with computer architecture.
Interview Questions: Use a simulator to simulate certain processors and compile results. Analyze the results to summarize a direction for this research to move forward. 7 days given.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: It only takes two interviews to complete the process. Come prepared to talk about past academic experiences and behavioral type interview questions. Also, be sure to ask informative questions about overtime options and how many professors you will have to answer to.
Interview Questions: How do you prioritize your time?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview was conducted by two professors and involved basic questions about prior experience, course work, yourself. There were no technical questions involved. Motive to join the Department and the ability to contribute to the ongoing research was tested thoroughly. Overall the process was simple and of average difficulty.How do you wish to contribute to the ongoing research in the Department. This was not unexpected but difficult for me since I am from an entirely different field of study.
Interview Questions: How do you wish to contribute to the ongoing research in the Department. This was not unexpected but difficult for me since I am from an entirely different field of study.

title: Fitness Monitor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Basic interview
Interview Questions: Fitness questions

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Hiring was base on my ability to interact with customer. I was also asked about my knowledge with computers, network, office products, printers, account management. I was also asked about my major, they prefer students who's major is in computer science.
Interview Questions:
Describe parts of a computer?
Can you describe how you would set up a network printer?

title: Program Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Meet with several admins to answer questions about workplace behavior and personality compatibility. Large group interview with associate dean, program coordinators, Review of work history, education, and experience. Answered several scenario questions. Open and relaxed.
Interview Questions: Scenario questions: Describe a time when you overcame a personal difficulty.

title: Senior Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Good. they were nice and asked me questions for which I was prepared. the interviewer was professional and showed me around the city places where I could live. I met with many other people and they were cordial. HOWEVER, I did not get important things I was promised during the interview.
Interview Questions: What do I want to teach there?

title: Research Associate II Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Asked about other experimental projects you have been working on, what classes your were taking. Where you see yourself in five years. Asked specifically about what lab techniques you were comfortable with, if you can work in group environment.
Interview Questions: Would you like to further your education?

title: Data Systems Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, get call from the HR for onsite interview. There was a panel of people from IT team and they asked lot of questions on my skill and experiences. Interviewer was very friendly and helpful, they described the job and my roles.
Interview Questions:
My previous experiences? skills? 
how did I applied my skills in workplace?
Year of experience on these skills?
How will I rate my skills?
why I am fit for this position? some situational question.

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: It is done by a panel of peers that have a list of questions to ask you. They ask behavior questions and technical questions. After the interview, they ask if you have any questions.
Interview Questions: experience

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Easy submission of application
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a Graduate Research Assistant

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Similar to what a lot of people have shared here, the process has four steps. The first step is a 30-minute phone chat with the HR. No technical questions were in the first round. The second step is a timed coding challenge hosted on HackerRank.
Interview Questions: data structure: heap, hash table internals

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Met with a prospective professor to discuss possible project ideas. If you have a potentially interesting project then the process is fairly simple. It takes forever to actually start working after you are "hired" though. we discussed what i have been studying, where i had worked, and what i plan to accomplish as a research assistant.
Interview Questions: Where have you worked before?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: Very basic questions about your history. I believe they just want to know you have passion to be a good teaching assistant and want to know your communication skill. There is no phone interview, just on-site. First interview is with dean of department and second interview is with professor. Interview questions" tell me about yourself" " Do you have any teaching history?"
Interview Questions: " tell me about yourself" " Do you have any teaching history?"

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: Spoke with prospective manager on the phone and scheduled an interview. Afterwards, met with prospective manager and reviewed my resume 1 on 1. Was asked some questions about my work history and how I dealt with problems on the job. Interview was over quickly and I was hired on the spot and sent to HR to sign paperwork.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation that you could have handled better

title: Undergraduate Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: Find a professor that you would like to do research with/for meet with them, bring resume if you aren't already acquainted. Its best to go for one you have had or are about to take a class with. Stress to them how you really want to get in to research and that you would really like to work in there lab.
Interview Questions: None, just a very casual conversation

title: Director of Design Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: The process took several months (5 to be exact). The application was done online at utsajobs.edu. Once past that hurdle, the initial interview was conducted over the phone with three people. Second interview was done in person with four people - one of them being the vice president of development.
Interview Questions: They asked me to critique their Alumni magazine.

title: Lecturer I Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: Emailed hiring staff and got my first on-site interview, during the interview I was asked about my previous teaching experiences, I think my easy going and patient personality is also very helpful for me to get the offer.
Interview Questions: Questions are mainly about my resume

title: Administrative Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Easy questions if you have experience.  This is a very entry level position so there wasn't a lot of difficulty to answering the questions.  I would recommend you review all of your prior experience before the interview as they asked a lot of questions about previous jobs.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for UTSA?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Filled out application on line, received an interview request within a week of applying, interviewed with lead administrative assistant, received request for second interview with department head within 2 days of initial interview, started working a week after second interview.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult questions in the interview. The questions were read from an interview form, and answers were noted in the provided blanks.

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Apply Online.
Interview Questions: Your interest area for research?

title: Career Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: All communication was clear and the job description matched my expectations. I have been happy ever since.
Interview Questions: What trends in career counseling am I aware of?

title: Student Affairs Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: Usually a phone screening, then panel interview at the Office.  Background check and a lot of hoops to jump through at HR. Had to submit application, cover letter, resume.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: You submit your resume and it will take about two to three weeks for you to get a call. Then they will schedule an interview with you and it usually will last about 15 to 20 minutes. The supervisor will be there with maybe one or two more lab assistants. Everyone very friendly. They will ask a set of questions and then explain what the job duties are and let you ask any questions at the end.
Interview Questions: There really are not any difficult questions. It mostly about your experience, strengths and weaknesses, what is great customer service.. things like that but nothing too hard.

title: Engineering Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: The culture was friendly and the interview process wasn't very difficult.  The STAR method can be used to answer the questions. I believe that most of the time the interviewers want all if not most of the qualifications that are requested.
Interview Questions: What are your salary expectations for this position?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: The search committee did not have someone from my area and they are interested in finding out how you can bring in more money. Questions were not scientific or less about my teaching experience but how one could bring in more money.
Interview Questions: Some professors advised not to take the position and asked why I was interested

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: I did not have a traditional interview process.  I was informed of the research position through a scholarship program that aimed to encourage minority students to gain research experience.  After applying for the position I received an email from my future employer about the opening in his research lab.  Once I discussed my interest and goals with him, he informed me about his goals for me.  I then expressed my interest to work with him and we agreed on a work schedule.
Interview Questions: I was not any traditional questions.  My interview process was more of an informal discussion about my interest.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: Initial communications can occur during undergraduate courses. Students are encouraged to meet professors in the desired field, and discuss the professors with research work. Usually, future employees are given 1-2 weeks to prove his/her capabilities.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in doing this field of research?

title: Engineering Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Sept 2009
Interview Descriptions:
Applied on-line and 26 days later received a phone call on a Thursday around 2:30PM.
HR rep stated interview would be the following Thursday and gave me 3 afternoon time slots to pick from.
Showed up 15 minutes before interview start time.
Start time didn't start on time. I waited 45 minutes.
It was a 3 on 1 interview and lasted about an hour. I was told they ask the same questions to all candidates. First question was regarding salary, specifically they gave an amount and said was I OK with that amount. Other questions: tell me a time when you were in a difficult situation thats work related and how you handled it, what do you feel more comfortable with, verbal communications or in person communications, why is it important to maintain customer satisfaction, and other job related technical questions...
Interview Questions: First question asked was about salary and I wasn't expecting that. They gave me an amount and then asked if I was satisfied with the amount.

title: Operations Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: I sat in at many interviews while I was a Facility Manager at the Campus Recreation.  It is a laid back interview.  Dress should be at least business casual for student interviews.  The employees are really nice especially the professional staff.  Use the word "initiative" in your interview.  Something like "I am always one to step up and take initiative.
Interview Questions: 1.	Tell us why you would like to work with the Operations Staff in Campus Recreation?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions:
First, follow your resume. Asked several projects on my resume. Lots of detail related with the professor's research project.
Second, couple of questions about the future plan and what's the short term and long term goal.
Third, talked about their own research and what you can contribute and whether you are interested in it or not.
Finally, let me asked one question.
Interview Questions: The question is what's big difference between the discrete control system and continuous control system

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Texas at San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Feb 2009
Interview Descriptions: There were a lot of interviews. One by the hiring manager, one by the hiring committee one by the leadership team of the department I worked in. I was there for half a day and everyone asked the same formulaic questions. People were nice and open about the challenges about working for a state agency, given that I came from the private sector.
Interview Questions: Nothing too difficult or unexpected.
